title: In the previous activities you solved few problems on searching algorithms. In this activity  also there are few more questions please answer those questions

quizDescription.text: Here is code for linear search that uses the fact that a set of elements is sorted in increasing order:
Consider the following code, which is an alternative version of search.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements is correct? You may assume that each function is tested with a list L whose elements are sorted in increasing order; for simplicity, assume L is a list of positive integers.

options.option: search and newsearch return the same answers for all L and e.
search and newsearch return the same answers provided L is non-empty.
search and newsearch return the same answers provided L is non-empty and e is in L.
search and newsearch never return the same answers.
search and newsearch return the same answers for lists L of length 0, 1, or 2.
